com.tsgrp.migration.event.pipeline

Class PipelineTimeZoneSwitcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tsgrp.migration.event.AbstractListener
      • com.tsgrp.migration.event.pipeline.PipelineTimeZoneSwitcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PipelineBeginEngageEventListener

    public class PipelineTimeZoneSwitcher
extends AbstractListener
implements PipelineBeginEngageEventListener
    This listener will change the default timezone that the JVM is running in when OpenMigrate starts up. This is particularly useful for any migrations that will use JDBC to insert date values into a database. To ensure that date values are inserted correctly into the DB, the JVM time zone should match the time zone of all other dates in the database. For example, the DFC automatically inserts all dates in GMT time, regarless of the time zone of the machine that the DB is running on.
